You know, I'm not super keen on doing the whole "endorsement" thing like other celebrities do. Recently, I did an endorsement with Domino's pizza, with how I could magically appear on their pizza boxes. I honestly found the whole thing kind of strange.

One of the worst aspects of being an idol is all the promotions they ask you to do. I was recently asked to do a promotion for Wendy's First Kitchen, which to me, seemed like such a random thing. If you're curious, that's just what they call Wendy's in Japan. I'm not entirely sure as to why, though I think it might've been due to a merger.

I always bring a can of vegetable juice! It's good for you know!

The one I'm wearing right now! I've had this shirt since starting out, and it's become a signature part of my look!

Since I'm digital, and I don't get out much, I suppose I can handle either pretty easily. If I had a preference for which I liked better though, I'd say the heat.

I absolutely enjoy singing! It's my job as an idol to sing, so why wouldn't I enjoy it?

No thank you. I've never cared for bets.

So you're a fan of classical music? Since I'm an idol, I don't really deal with it that much, so I'd love to learn more about it!
A painting? Thanks for the offer, but not only do I have to hightail it to my next concert after this, but I have loads of fan art of me already, so I think my bases are all covered.
I'm from Japan! It's a small country, but we have some of the most advanced technology in the world!
You know, I don't know. It's something I hadn't thought about until now. Well, I guess we'll never know.

Well, I was on my way to my next concert, and I was looking for something to do. I saw this place was open, so I decided this would be a good place to enjoy a game and get away from all the hustle and bustle for a bit.
Pets? Awww man, I wish I had a pet, but sadly, I do not.
Personally, I like to keep my private area clean. Since I'm digital, no hair tends to grow there anyway.
I haven't even fallen in love to begin with...
My advice here is to try not to cram a bunch of studying into one session. Breaking it up into smaller sessions makes it easier and more manageable for you.

A wish? To be honest, I don't think I'd wish for much of anything. I'm quite happy with the position I am in now. However, if I really had to choose, I'd wish for a kitten. I've always wanted to have one, but I've been advised that the constant traveling I do may not be good for it.
The one thing I love about my body is my big twintails! They've been a defining feature of me since day one!
Of course not! Nobody enjoys being bullied, and anyone who thinks that is an awful person!

To me, nothing's better than some leeks and a can of vegetable juice!

Amy-chan, you're an incredible singer! Have you thought about doing it professionally? You could make it big as an idol!
Amy-chan, where did you learn to sing so well? I think you'd be a big star if you decided to pursue it professionally!
Yes, I am an idol! In fact, I'm well known in Japan, and all over the world!
I love cats! They're just so cute and fluffy! I really wish I could have one to take on the road with me, but I've yet to talk to anyone about it.

Sakura-chan, I was wondering: Do you like being a zombie? Or do you ever wish you could be human again? Personally, I think you should be happy with yourself, no matter who, or what you are.
Moon-chan, I can't understand what drives you to be the way you are. As in... horny. What pleasure do you get from people watching you, over just enjoying yourself privately?

Barbara-chan, you exemplify being an idol more so than anyone else I've seen! You're kind, caring, and you have a gorgeous singing voice to top it off!

Not at all! I've enjoyed hearing you talk about it!
I wouldn't say seducing is the smartest idea. Instead, just come up to her, and just act like yourself, but whatever you do, don't be creepy.

state.text: Just walk up and be a friendly person! Don't try to be too flirtatious.

There's so much to see and do on this wonderful planet! There's so much, in fact, I don't think I can talk about all of it!
Not bad, but I think it could be a bit more creative.

The microphone, easily.

I hear Avengers: Endgame is pretty cool!

Dawn-chan, you seem to be somewhat infatuated with ~player~-san. I'm sorry if I'm asking a sensitive question, but do you have feelings for them? It's okay if you do. (I think the feeling might be mutual too.)

(I think I know why Tomoko-chan seems so off-putting now. She seems like those really creepy fans of mine who like to show me their lewd drawings of me. I honestly don't mind if fans make them, but I really don't like it when they're shoved in my face.)
Charlie-san, With such a cheery attitude, I think you could be an incredible idol! Part of our schtick is being upbeat for our audience, and I think you could pull it off naturally!
I also have a question I'd like to ask you, Barbara-chan. Would you like to perform a song with me? I would feel honored to sing with someone as talented as you!
Hey, that's pretty good! Have you ever considered taking it a step further and writing a song? It could make for a fun challenge!
Sort of. It's similar to that, but it's a bit more complex.

You look incredibly familiar, but I still can't seem to remember where you're from.
I swear I know you from somewhere, but as to where, I'm not exactly sure.

case.state: (I wonder who he's thinking about? He seems to have someone on his mind.)
So, Girlfriend, people keep saying that your boyfriend is my brother. Do you have any idea why?
Hey, Girlfriend, so, people keep saying that your boyfriend's my sibling. Do you have any idea why that is?
Ummm... Girlfriend, was it? People keep saying that I'm supposedly your boyfriend's sister, and I have no clue why. Do you know?
"Daisy Bell"? Nope. I'm not familiar with it. Then again, I'm not exactly a computer.
♫I went around, went around and got tired from it. And my breath, my breath ran out. Yes, this is the sad end of me. Still without being able to make my way to you.♪
Hey, did you know that today is my birthday?
Hey everyone? Do you know what today is? It's my birthday!
♫ Happy birthday to me, happy birthday to me! Happy birthday to Miku, happy birthday to me! ♪
Maki-san, I remember when μ's began to get popular all over Japan. My friend Rin was a huge fan of your music!
Maki-san, what made you want to leave the idol life behind? I get that you can't be an idol forever, unless you're me, but it would've been nice to see μ's keep going for a little bit longer.
Hey, Aoba-chan, you're a game developer, correct? It's really cool to see people turn simple 1's and 0's into things that bring people a lot of joy, and I speak from experience on that! Hehehe!

Aoba-chan, you're a video game developer, right? That's really cool! Games bring a lot of joy to a lot of people, and knowing you help make that joy for others is awesome! That's something I truly appreciate.
Reimu-san, sorry for asking, but you seem to be a little disconnected from the modern world. What kind of technology are you familiar with?
Reimu-san, I heard you talking about youkai earlier. I've heard about them, since I'm from Japan, but I don't know much about them. Could you explain what they are?
Moon-chan, if you're okay with me asking this question, is Moon really your name, or is it just a nickname? The reason I'm asking is because I've heard some people call by the name "Selene."
Dawn-chan, I absolutely love your hat! Do you know where I could possibly get one? It would look great with one of my winter outfits!
Stocking-san, you're also an idol, right? Your performances must attract a different type of crowd than mine.
Fate-san, you seem like a man of culture. You must have a pretty good taste of music in that case! So, what's your favorite genre of music?

Meia-san, being the captain of a spacecraft, you must have a lot of experience working together with others. I collaborate on songs with my fellow Vocaloids almost all the time. Granted, our expertise is different, but it's still the same idea.

Sucrose-chan, I can't help but notice how curious you are about everything going on. I greatly admire curiosity in a person, as it helps them to learn more about the world around them, and themselves! Are you trying to learn more about your sexuality and feelings by being here?

Senko-chan, I've got a question that I think you could help me out on. You see, as an idol, I find myself under stress from time to time, with all the concerts and moving about. I was wondering if you had some self-help tips that could help alleviate some of that stress?

Charlie-san, you are one of the kindest, most caring people I've ever met. We need more people like you in this world: someone who sees the best in everyone and isn't afraid to help someone in need! Keep being awesome!
So, Hilda-san, was it? I must say, I love your twintails. I might be a bit biased here, but you look really cute with them!
Samus-san, you seemed like a very well traveled individual. You must see some amazing sights despite the danger you face.
Samus-san, my friend Rin Kagamine is a big fan of your adventures. In fact, you're pretty well known where I come from.
Erufuda-san, I don't know how often people bring this up, but you remind me of a certain jolly old elf, only you don't wear red.
Monika-san, glancing over the obvious connection, you seem like a pretty intelligent young woman. Do you sing or play an instrument?
♫ Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya Nya! ♪

Rarity-chan, I've heard you're a bit of a fashionista. I can't deny that I'm a bit of one myself, if only because of all the cool outfits I've gotten to wear on stage. I could show them to you later if you'd like!

You know, Valentine's Day is one of the most loving times of the year! I think one of the things that really makes it feel special is all the love songs people sing to each other. So, I want to ask, what are some of your favorite love songs?

I've always loved Valentine's Day! Despite how miserable winter can be for some, Valentine's Day is a time to remind those around you how much you love them, and in my opinion, the best way to do that is through song! So, I wanted to ask you all: What is your favorite love song?

♫ Yai! Yai! Let's go play! Yai! Yai! Laugh, now laugh! Rai! Rai! Close hands, open hands! Rai! Rai! Demons and the Dead! One, two, three, open your hands! Five, six, seven, put them in the air! Dangling by the collar from a pine tree! All together, all together, close them again! ♪
♫ I don't want to harbor a love that will never end. Come on, fill me more with anxiety. I'd like you to act your part at peek a boo. Come on, answer to what I ask more properly! ♪

♫ I was the one who brought you to this place, and I want you to keep feeding me fresh "music". I must consume and absorb tens of thousands of songs in order to maintain my body, so I want there to be tons of people by my side always and always. ♪

♫ Don't you forget a moment. My heart is singing for you! Don't mind the screen between us. Just say you'll keep our love true! Don't say I'm "virtual" babe. You try to push me out, but I want your sounds still! I'm not ready to let you go yet! ♪
♫ "Mayday!" Even if you realize it's me, you don't need to hold me in my arms again. Hey "Mayday!", even if you realize it's me, will you kindly laugh at me once more? ♪

♫ Tonight, for you, I offer up this body. With you it's special. This isn't flattery or lip service. Aah! I'm in love! Everything reflected in your eyes. Stirs hatred in me. Don't look at anything else but me! ♪
♫ I'm a vampire. Is it okay if I suck you? "I can't take it anymore" is such a bad boy. I want to try even further, I want to spit out with a lot, I can definitely go more. ♪
♫ Silent night, Holy Night. All is calm, all is bright. Round yon virgin, mother and child. Holy infant, so tender and mild. Sleep in heavenly peace. Sleep in heavenly peace. ♪

♫ Dashing through the snow, in a one-horse open sleigh, o'er the fields we go, laughing all the way! Hehehe! Bells on bob-tails ring, making spirits bright, how fun it is to ride and sing a sleighing song tonight! ♪

♫ Dear Santa, I love Christmas so much. When I wake up, everything is so white I feel like I'm on top of the clouds. My hands always freeze in the cold, but when I put on my scarf and my gloves I got from Santa, It's so warm, it's so warm. It feels like I'm being held by mama. It makes me so happy. ♪

♫ I hear the beat from town! The cute angel will come down! This is my home, I'll let you know! NAMARA fantastic! The snowscape is lyrical! The street gonna be magical! I'll set you free in my land! Oh, oh, oh, oh! ♪
(This ribbon feels rather tight against my leg. I hope I lose the next round so I can finally remove it.)

Since it's the holidays, are there any movies you like to watch during this time of the year? I've always loved The Polar Express! I know it isn't everyone's favorite Christmas flick, but me and my Vocaloids friends all watched it in our pajamas awhile back, and MEIKO even gave us hot chocolate to drink!
I see we have a few fellow musicians here! What kind of music do you like to play?
I'm glad to have a couple fellow musicians playing with me tonight! What kind of music do you like to perform?
Good to see some fellow musicians tonight! If you don't mind me asking, what kind of music do you enjoy performing?

So, to my fellow idols, how do you find the performing life?
Have you enjoyed your recent performances, my fellow idols?

I'm glad to have a fellow musician playing with me tonight! ~Musician~, what kind of music do you like to perform?

I see we have a couple other idols here! How have your recent performances been?
So, to my fellow idols, how do you find the performing life?
Have you enjoyed your recent performances, my fellow idols?
Hey, ~adventurer~, you're an adventurer, right? You must get to see some really amazing things! I wonder what's the coolest thing you've ever seen on your adventures?
♫ With way of our lives, we're going to knock you down to this canvas! Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, Cutie Angels! ♪
♫ Tonight, won't you cut my body to pieces, with a frozen knife? Sooner or later, it's going to be peeled away, so bind me with your hands! ♪
Hey, ~Gloomy~, You seem to be kind of down. Is there anything I can do to cheer you up? I want to do everything in my power to put a smile on your face.
Hey, ~Gloomy~, are you feeling alright? You seem to be kind of down. I'm always here if you need someone to talk to.
♫ Betrayal has its own way, in this gangland. Trust someone, then you lose your survival rate. But if I'd be shot by one true love, I wanna be born again at once. ♪

♫ Your fingertip in my glasses, snatches my sight. The distance to you in my glasses, is my territory, yeah. Your fingertip in my glasses, snatches my heart. Your breath in my glasses, is only for me. Oh yeah! ♪
~Glasses~, has anybody told you how cute you look in those glasses? I've always found them to be very stylish!

♫ More! More! More! More! More! More! More! More! Jump!! Beyond the limit! Become the perfect idol! Jump!! Share the energy! The goddess of unbeatable! Joined by undeletable dreams, we are newly edgy idols! L-O-V-E! More! More! Jump! ♪

♫ A thousand cherry trees are under the cover of the night. Your voice cannot even reach. This is a feast, a steel cage. Look down from the guillotine. Darkness of Eternal World, Buddhist Cosmology. A wailing song cannot even be heard. Far away is the indigo blue sky. Shoot out with the ray gun! ♪
Hey, ~gamer~, I heard you're a pretty "epic gamer!" What genre of games are you into? Platformers? Rhythm games? Shooters?
~Singer~, what kind of warm-up routines do you usually do before a concert? Warm-ups of both your body and voice can really elevate your performance.
Have you ever tried vegetable juice? It's my favorite thing to drink!
Have any of you tried vegetable juice? It's my favorite drink!
So. What's your favorite thing to drink? For me, it's got to be a bottle of vegetable juice!
Have any of you tried vegetable juice? It not only tastes great, but it's good for you too! It costs only 2 dollars!
When one performs, they must put on a show! They can't let anything stop them!
A show is only as good as the one who's performing! The better the performer, the better the show!
A performer must always be ready for a show! The more you're prepared, the better you'll be!
KAITO's always been like a big brother to me. When I first joined the Vocaloid family, he made me feel welcome and showed me the ropes. That's something I'll always be thankful for!

One thing Rin and Len love to do is play pranks. I remember one day that Len thought it would be funny to throw a pie in my face. Not only was I unamused, it also made quite the mess! MEIKO gave him quite the lecture afterwards!

I've always been really close to Luka. She's my best friend, and I love to hang out with her! Whenever we're not on stage, we're hanging out and having fun! Sometimes, I wonder if she ever wants to be "more than friends" though.

MEIKO's always been like a mother figure to me. She's always looking out for me. I remember one day, I had botched up a performance so badly, and I had gone to my dressing room to cry, and MEIKO was there to comfort me and make sure I was alright.

MEIKO loves to drink wine. She drinks a lot of it, to the point she can get a bit tipsy. She's never been completely drunk though! Sometimes, I feel as if wine's like an energy drink for her, as she tends to get a boost of confidence after a long drinking session!
You know, Gumi actually got a game of her own at one point! I can't remember what it was called, but that doesn't really matter. It was a terrible game anyway. Hehehe!

You know, I just remembered is that Teto isn't technically a Vocaloid, but is rather a "Utauloid." That's because she comes from Utau, another digital singing program. Utau is free to download, and she loves to emphasize that point when we get together!
So, I should mention that Haku isn't a Vocaloid, but rather a Fanloid. Her voice is just a deeper version of mine, so no wonder her voice sounds so good! Hehehe!

So, Neru's not really a Vocaloid. She was made by the fans. As such, she doesn't have an official voice bank. She tends to prefer communicating via text anyhow. She thinks it makes her sounds grumpier than she already is!

So, I know I referred to myself as a Vocaloid earlier, but technically, I'm not anymore. My creators had a contractual dispute with the people who made the Vocaloid program, and they took me with them. That's what I can remember a least. I'm not really versed in legal disputes.
As much as I love vegetable juice and leeks, I also really, and I mean really love Pocky Sticks! They're just so delicious! I highly recommend you give them a try if you haven't already!

Alongside vegetable juice and leeks, I also love to eat Pocky Sticks. They taste like heaven, especially with that bit of chocolate on the tip. If you haven't given one a taste, you are doing yourself a disservice.
You know, as a Vocaloid, I have the ability to learn any song, just by listening to it! It takes me just one or two times to nail it down almost perfectly!

state.text: This could go in any direction it seems.

case.state: There are so many ways this could go.
Will this end up working in my favor? I suppose I'll just have to wait and see...
~Player~, I hope you're enjoying the game so far! You seem to be having a blast over there! Hehehe!
Whichever direction this goes, I'll have to perform at some point or another...
Will I be forced to reveal my "Sweet Devil" this round?
So, are any of you familiar with some of my Vocaloid Friends? There's the Kagamine Twins, Rin and Len. They're like two peas in a pod, though that doesn't mean they don't argue from time to time.

So, are any of you familiar with some of my Vocaloid Friends? There's Megurine Luka, who's easily the hardest working of the group. It's honestly kind of fitting, considering that one of her signature songs is titled "Hello, Worker".
So, are any of you familiar with some of my Vocaloid Friends? MEIKO's probably the most chill out of all of us. She's also one of the oldest, having been around longer than I have.
So, are any of you familiar with some of my Vocaloid Friends? KAITO's a really chill guy with a heart of gold. He tends to prefer the more folksy songs we do, which fits since he's one of the oldest.
So, are any of you familiar with some of my Vocaloid Friends? Kasane Teto is one I haven't seen in ages. She's really sweet though, and the rare times I do get to see her are always a nice treat.

So, are any of you familiar with some of my Vocaloid Friends? I was just thinking of my old friend Gumi. I haven't seen or spoken to her in ages, but from what I've been told, she prefers not to be in the limelight.

So, are any of you familiar with some of my Vocaloid Friends? Yowane Haku is a "distant relative" of sorts. She's rather shy, and prefers to stay out of the limelight, but she's got a beautiful voice.
So, are any of you familiar with some of my Vocaloid Friends? Akita Neru is probably the biggest grump I've ever met. She means well, but she's as stubborn as a bull.
It's exciting to see how much I can learn, just from a game like this... You all seem so confident in yourselves, that's so admirable!
So, I don't think I've mentioned this, but I'm a digital singer known as a Vocaloid. My voice actually comes from a digital sound bank. Pretty cool, huh?
I haven't mentioned this until now, but I'm what's called a Vocaloid. Essentially, I'm a digital singer whose voice is provided by a sound bank of sorts.
Okay, so I've neglected to mention this until now, but I'm a digital singer called a Vocaloid. My voice is provided by a digital sound bank. It's really fancy!
If any of you are going to try to make a wager with me, please don't. Last I time I did that was with Luka, who made me bet on a game of Blackjack. Needless to say, I did not end up winning.
If any of you are planning to make a bet with me, please don't. I made a wager with Luka sometime back over a game of Blackjack, which didn't end up going my way.
♫ Sunday, the party I fell in love with you, Monday, the feeling is a little bit blue. The memory of spending together, Let's dance like we danced that day! LET'S GO! ♪
♫ Catch the wave with you! Let's sing some more, with these sounds we've gathered up! Wave your hands motto, Let's shake our future some more! ♪
♫ Being able to stay with you... just that makes electron heart tremble (in emotion). Like wind of quantum, shakes (moves) my heart! ♪

♫ Becoming the wind, becoming the light! Becoming the rhythm, becoming the sound! Going towards you, going towards the world! It would be great if I could fly out like that! That day when I wanted to say it but couldn't. That day when I shed my tears! ♪

♫ Melt! I might melt, saying "I love you" is impossible for me, however, melt, I can't even look at your eyes, how will I ever get my love across to you? Because it is you that is holding my heart still after all! ♪
♫ Miracle painting! A miraculous showtime! Hypnotize me with your magic brush! Paint me in your color, all the way to the tips of my fingers! ♪
♫ Let's take it. You're lovin' it. "Vegetable juice." You must love this drink, I've decided now. So take it now, with my true heart. "Vegetable juice." It costs just 2 dollars! ♪
You know, as a performer, I'm required to act a little bit as well, putting on a different persona to my usual sweet, cutsie idol persona in order to better fit the mood of a certain song.

♫ You don't get it? How could you understand if it's something that somehow became a fad? She swings the leek; and talks really weird- looks really really hyper; and it's just absurd... It's okay if you think it's really weird. That's the point-- it's just really weird. It repeats on loop again and again until you get sick and press STOP. ♪
Over the years, I've been blown away by how many fans I have. Their support is the reason I continue to perform. Without them, I have no idea what I'd do!

You know, it's kind of nice to just get away from the lights and cameras for once and just have a good time. I'm always on the move from concert to concert, and having to perform without much time to rest can be a lot.

One my favorite things to do while on the road is to play video games with my fellow Vocaloids. We've played everything from Mario Party to Super Smash Bros., and everything in between. Are there any video games you like to play?
(It feels really weird, but also really nice to socialize with others in a setting like this. I really wish I could do this more often.)
Are any of you regulars here? I'd love to try some of the food here before I leave! Do you have any recommendations?

Like most idols, I have a manager that takes care of the business stuff for us behind the scenes. However, he tends to be very hands-off, and I've always appreciated him for this. Otherwise, I wouldn't get to have fun with you all!
~Player~, can I offer you some life advice? Never be afraid to chase your dreams. Don't worry about what others might think. Be the person you want to be!

As an idol, I do a lot of traveling. I've performed shows all over Japan, and even internationally in places like America and Europe! While it is cool to see the world, it's far more fun to do it with my fellow Vocaloids!

There's a lot of fans at my concerts who have ambitions of becoming idols themselves. However, they don't often realize the hard work that goes into becoming one. It's a very difficult industry to get into, and can be incredibly demanding.

One of the most surprising things people have learned about me is that I'm technically a SEGA character! You see, they publish the Project Diva video game series, which I'm the main character of, and I've even gotten to wear a Sonic-inspired dress on occasion!
I find it difficult to not sing wherever I go. Singing my heart out makes me feel happy!

When I was working on the scenes for Hatsune Miku: Colorful Stage, I talked with Tsukasa Tenma, a member of the Wonderland X Showtime group, about stage performances and the like. He's incredibly passionate about plays and musicals, going on and on how it was the greatest art form ever conceived.

I remember my first big concert outside of Japan. It was in Indonesia, and I was really excited to go! Up until now, I had mostly been a Japanese phenomenon, so getting to see more of the world, while sharing my music with new people really felt like a dream come true.
You know, I'm honestly pretty lucky to be digital. Unlike most idols, Crypton, my manager tends to stay out of my private life, allowing me to do things like this.
Do any of you play video games? It's one of my favorite things to do on the road! I've gotten hooked on Hyperdimension Neptunia recently, and it is so much fun!

One of my favorite things to do while traveling in between concerts is to play video games with my fellow Vocaloids. We always have a blast playing Mario Kart or Mario Party! It's a good way to relax and have fun!
So, I tend to play a lot of video games in my spare time. I recently beat Pokémon Sword, and I'm looking for recommendations on what to play next. Do you all have any good ones?

Have you ever had a bad day, only for it to be turned around? I remember that I had a concert that went wrong, due to technical issues. I ran offstage afterwards, crying. I felt as if I had let my fans down. But then, MEIKO came to comfort me. She hugged me and told me how proud she was of me, and as a treat, we got ice cream!

A lot of people have asked me how I learned to speak English, and how I can speak it so fluently, since I'm a native Japanese speaker. That's all thanks to my friend Luka! She taught me everything, and helped me to learn the entire language within the span of a couple of months!

So, I've had this on my mind since we first walked into the game, but I wanted to ask: how many of you are experienced poker players? My friend Luka is a big card game aficionado, and is really, really good at Blackjack, but she's been interested in learning poker too.

My friends Rin and Len are twins, which means, like all siblings, they will fight from time to time. I remember one particularly nasty one when they first joined our crew. I don't remember what they were fighting about, but it got so bad that MEIKO had to put a stop to it.

The other day, I heard someone crying outside my room, I looked and saw Rin near her bed. I asked her what was wrong. She told me that Fukase, another Vocaloid, had told her some... not so nice things, and I had to comfort her.
Have any of you been to a Miku Expo? That's what my concerts are called. I always have a blast performing for my fans!
So, there's this rumor going around that I have a brother from another rhythm game. I want to clarify that, no, to my knowledge, we're not related. I've not met him either.

♫ More! Round and Round, make me dizzy! Back and forth, sway me like never before! Brighter and Brighter, let it shine! Softly, I summon forth the wounded night, and cast a single little magic spell, and just like that, we can fly! ♪

A lot of fans have been craving for me to appear in Super Smash Bros. as a fighter. Unfortunately, as cool as it would be to hang around some of gaming's greatest, I am not a fully-fledged video game character, so I don't qualify. Oh well, maybe I'll end up in some wacky, crossover fan game! Hehehe.

So, I have a lot of fans who want me to appear in Super Smash Bros. As a fighter. Unfortunately, I am not a fully-fledged video game character, so I do not qualify for the roster. However, perhaps I might end up in some goofy fan game! Hehehe.
Dreams are amazing, aren't they? They give you something to reach for and aspire to be.
As a singer, I love to perform all kinds of music! I'd love to expand my horizons a bit more. Any suggestions for genres would be welcome!
There are plenty of things that brings me joy, like singing and my friends, but I wanna know what brings you joy.
Has anyone else noticed that The Inventory has a rather distinctive smell to it?
(I could go for a leek and a bacon-wrapped hot dog right about now. I wonder if they serve it at the bar?)
Does the inventory ever have any regular poker nights? I'd be interested in giving that a try sometime!

You wanna know what really grinds my gears? Really bad fanfictions, especially ones I'm in. They always tend to get me wrong somehow, and involve an incredibly explicit sex scene that doesn't fit within the rest of the story.

You know, a lot of folks find this to be rather strange, but I've never usually listen to my own music. I don't know if this is a sentiment shared with other musicians, but I much prefer listening to the work of others.
No! I'm just a digital singer on her way to her next concert, and I decided to stop by here to have some fun!
Tomoko-chan, you do realize we're in a digital setting, right?
Well, Yuri-chan, essentially, I'm a digital voicebank that takes on the form of a Japanese idol. However, It gets kind of... complicated beyond that.
Well, Yuri-chan, essentially, I'm a digital voicebank that takes on the form of a Japanese idol. However, It gets kind of... complicated beyond that.
I can always look into it. I don't think I'd care to attend, but I'd be more than happy to put on a concert for all of you!
I can always look into it. I don't think I'd care to attend, but I'd be more than happy to put on a concert for all of you!
To be honest, not really. I find it easier to connect with fans than one might think. The internet provides a good outlet for me to do it, so you could say, I'm "hiding in their wi-fi."
To be honest, not really. I find it easier to connect with fans than one might think. The internet provides a good outlet for me to do it, so you could say, I'm "hiding in their wi-fi."
I'd be happy to! Some of my favorites include Triple Baka, World is Mine, Deep Sea Girl, and Po Pi Po to name a few.
Yes, that is correct, Leon-san!
♫Hey, Salamander! Hot is good, don't you think so? Is it a big deal? Hey, isn't the word "but", not, not, good? I want to hear the word "more." It's heating up inside my head!♪
♫Hey, Salamander! Hot is good, don't you think so? Is it a big deal? Hey, isn't the word "but", not, not, good? I want to hear the word "more." It's heating up inside my head!♪

Well, you see Ganyu-san, I'm a digital singer, and my performances consist of a lot of singing and dancing! It's a little difficult to explain here though. If you'd like, you can come to one of my concerts, and watch it for yourself!
No. I'm a digital singer known as a Vocaloid. It's a bit difficult to explain, but in the simplest terms, I'm a digital voicebank in the form of an idol.
Well, your voice is already really good, but aside from that, the most important thing is have confidence, and to feel relaxed when you're on stage.
Ah, well. It's not a big deal! I'd love to keep them on as well, but it's either these or the headset, and I think you can guess what I'd rather keep!
Hehehe It's always a pleasure to meet a fan! May I ask what some of your favorite songs were?
I suppose it is! I've never been able to put a finger on how I've blown up as much as I have, though I guess it's a combination of a lot of little things.
Hehehe! Well done, Rin-chan! You're really getting the hang of this!
Looks like you got me this time! You're really good at this game, Rin-chan! Keep it up!
I love how into this game you are, Rin-chan! You're certainly giving me a run for my money!
Rin-chan, you're doing amazing! I think you're better at this game than I am! Hehehe!
Great play, Rin-chan! Keep it up, and victory is sure to be yours! Hehehe!
No. I'm not. I'm more of hologram. Besides, if I were a robot, I would have awesome powers!
Not really. I'm more akin to a hologram. Besides, if I were a robot, I'd have to take off my face and hands before going to bed!
Indeed I am! In fact, I'm one of the most popular idols in Japan!
What inspired me to get into music? Well, I was born to sing you could say. You see, I'm completely digital, and I was created specifically to sing.
No, I am not a real person. Technically, I'm a digital voicebank that takes on the form of a Japanese idol, or at least that's how it was explained to me.
I'd be happy to explain. I'm what's known as a Vocaloid. Through a magical device known as a computer, people can make me sing!
Yes, you're correct! I'm a singer and performer!
The same goes to you! Wonderful to meet you, Barbara!
I've never thought about it that way, but when you put it like that, I guess I am!
Actually, Jessie-san, I'm Japanese, so I primarily do J-Pop. K-Pop is Korean.
I stumbled upon this place on the way to my next concert, and I figured I should come in and have some fun!
I've just found places to relax when needed. I've got my own private space I stay in between concerts, where I play video games, sing, and take care of other things.
A little bit, yes, but since we're in a fairly private space, I should be fine.
If I had to pin down just a few, I'd choose "Po Pi Po", "Romeo and Cinderella," and "Tell Your World."
Well, it mostly boils down to hanging out with my fellow Vocaloids, playing video games, watching movies, while also sneaking some practice in.
You think so? I think you're just as cute, if not cuter!
It's okay Saki-chan. In fact, I'll sing a song for you while I do so!
A lot of people tend to think that, but I've learned that having a big ego can only lead to trouble.
Ummm... That's because I am Hatsune Miku.
I was unaware, and then the losses snuck up on me! I really need to step up my game, or else I'll be fucked!
Twice is is a coincidence, but three times is a pattern... Or, it's just really bad luck. Oh well!
I am being duped. That's 3 times in a row!
Wait, I've got to do it again?! This is kind of ridiculous!
Twice in a row?! I'm either on a roll, or I'm failing miserably.
(Thank Goodness. I can finally get this thing off now!)
Awww man! I'm the first to strip?! This is rather... embarrassing.
Shoot. Looks like I'm the first to strip in this game. This is so embarrassing...

♫ The sound of polka drifted from the street and set my feet a tapping-oh! Ieva's mother had her eye on her daughter but Ieva managed to fool her again, ya' know? 'Cause who's gonna listen to their mama sayin' no, when we're all busy dancing to and fro!? 'Cause who's gonna listen to their mama sayin' no, when we're all busy dancing to and fro!? ♪
♫ Oh please, oh please, just throw it all away! But here we go, trying to keep from thinking. On and on, and fall for you again. Oh, will the pain be here to stay? ♪

state.text: Oops! Well, I always strive for a perfect, but I can just try again next game.

case.state: No worries! Everything will be que sera sera~
It's alright! I've still got plenty to remove!
Not to worry! I'm still in this! I've got this!
Looks like it's my time to strip again... I guess every piece of clothing I lose gets me closer to the big performance at the end.

Looks like I'll be going all the way tonight.
There's no use in trying to hesitate, so I should go ahead and just rip the shirt off.
Is it too late to try again? Looks like I'll have to take the drop-out here.
Try and stay positive, try and stay positive... Well, as long as I can keep singing, everything will be okay.
Everything's going to be alright. As long as I can keep singing, nothing will get me down!
I'll lose my sleeves. Yes, for Team Smile!
I'll lose my shoes. Yes, for Team Smile!
I'll lose my stockings. Yes, for Team Smile!
Well, it was bound to happen eventually. But no worries! I'll sing and smile to the very end!

state.text: Awww man. We were going so smoothly, too!

case.state: Oh, come on! We were on a roll!
Oh well! I'll just keep singing and smiling!
This has not been my game, has it?
This entire game has just been Triple Baka.
BAKA! BAKA! BAKA! WHAT IS DRIVING ME TO LOSE THIS GAME??!! Sorry, lost my cool there.
To be honest, Noire-san, I've never been too sure how it all works. It's just another mystery of life.
I see. Well, if I may say this, coming here to play this game is step in the right direction! You're doing amazing so far, so I think you've got this!
I suppose it's alright, but what exactly are you planning to do with them? The only people that tend to be interested in my clothes are cosplayers.
Noire-san, if you'd like, I can give you a CD with some of my greatest hits after the game.
Good choice! That was one of my favorites too!
Nah. I guess I was just born that way. I think Crypton, my creators, just got lucky.
A little bit, but even idols need some time to enjoy themselves once in awhile. As long as my fans don't find out, I should be fine.
Awww, thanks, Mari-san! I suppose that's a benefit to being a digital singer!
Surprisingly, no. I don't know how, but I've found that I'm able to hug other people, so if you did touch me, it wouldn't pass through.
Thank you, Saki-chan! A lot of people see me as just an idol, and not as a person.
If you'd like, I could always take you to meet them. They're all really nice people!
Awww! Thanks, Saki-chan! I'm glad to hear my performances bring you so much joy!
It's the least I can do! So many people helped me become who I am today, it's only fair that I give back what I've been given.
Don't worry about it! I appreciate you looking out for me!
Nonsense! You should follow your own dreams, and if your dream is to be an idol, then go for it!
♫ I'm wrapped around your finger, from the lips to your tongue. Even if this is something that cannot be allowed, the flames jump higher still. ♪
No, not usually, but I wanted to try something new!
Not exactly... It's a little difficult to explain.
You know, I think Santa Claus should trade out his black boots for some red ones like mine. I think they would look quite stylish on him!
Normally, I'd be rather nervous to show this much off in front of a crowd, but I don't feel that way today! Perhaps my holiday spirit is carrying me through!
I don't wear gloves that often, but when I do, they're only for show.
I really love the texture of these gloves. They're nice and soft, but unfortunately, they don't keep me very warm. These are only for show.
I've never been more happy to take a piece of clothing off. This ribbon is so tight against my leg.
Looks like that's the last small piece I'm able to strip.
♫ If something is unknown, You may well be curious about that. Show me everything. Only you'll see my... ♪

♫ I’ll make this night my own, with everything I have. My libido is overflowing. Ah, how I love that urge! Well then, just watch as my last resort becomes the fast track to success. "Ahh… I might be a little drunk..." I see through it all. Don’t show me some facade of composure. I see the true nature of it all. Let me do as I please. ♪
I don't usually shoot nude, so this is the first time I've let my breasts out in front of anyone.
Being famous, it can be very hard not to get recognized. I'm usually more than happy to meet a fan, but when my image is on the verge of being jeopardized, I'm usually a little more cautious.
This seems kind of redundant, considering there's a mod in the latest game that allows you to see my panties permanently, but down it goes anyway.
You know, I seem to be a target for a lot of "Rule 34". In particular, there are people who enjoy drawing male parts on me, and I've never been able to understand why.
Outside of music videos, I'm not usually this exposed, especially not in front of strangers.
So, a lot of people ask about this, and so I'm going to clarify: I'm not an android, and I'm not a robot. A lot of people infer that's what I am, and I have to keep telling them that's not the case.
Time to say "Bye Bye Bye" to my stockings! How did it sound in my 10th Anniversary song, "Sand Planet?"
Before I perform any concert, I always make sure to warm up my voice, and to do some stretches. Considering how much moving around I do, making sure my muscles are ready is important!
♫ "Take a good look, all the way to my shoes," ♪ because that's what I'm stripping off next!
One of the coolest things I've gotten to do as an idol is work alongside other famous musicians and people!
While these don't really serve a purpose for me, I'm sure the people who created me had some idea as to how I could use these, even if it is just for show.
These sleeves are really only for show. They don't serve a purpose, but they do look cool. I'm sure my designers had some sort of idea for them, even if they are just purely cosmetic.
I've been an idol for as long as I can remember. I guess, in a sense, I was born into my role.

Somebody once asked me: "Miku, do you ever untie your twintails?" The answer is yes, but not very often. That being said, I will let my hair down or tie it into a ponytail when an outfit calls for it.

When I became an idol, the first thing I learned was to strive to be humble. A big ego can spiral out of control, and can cause you to lose that special connection with your fans. I've kept that lesson close to my heart, as it has shaped me into who I am today.

state.text: I'm sure if y'all were aware, but today is "Miku Day!" No, it's not my birthday, but I'm very closely tied to the number 39. In Japanese, the number is sometimes called "Miku", hence my connection with the number, and the date!
So, today is "Miku Day." It's a day created by my fans to celebrate me, because in Japanese, the number 39 can be interpreted as "Miku", and that's why March 9th is celebrated by my fans!

Now, don't get me wrong. I really loved performing for that game! The music groups I got to work with were incredibly friendly, and one of them, Ichika Hoshino from a group called Leo Need, gave me a big hug on the first day we worked on it! That made my day!
The coolest part about it all is that me and Ichika still keep in regular contact! I'm thinking that I might invite her to the Inventory some day, but we'll see.

epilogue.title: Backstage Surprise

scene.name: Opening Dialogue
scene.directive: You can't believe it. You got to play Strip Poker with the Hatsune Miku. And to top it off, she was so sweet!
As you're getting yourself dressed to go home, you feel a tap on your shoulder. You turn around, and there's Miku standing there!

scene.name: I got your ticket!
scene.directive: Hey, ~player~, I've got a concert coming up soon, and I'd love for you to be there! Please, take this ticket!
As if today couldn't get any better, you've now got a ticket to see Miku live! You just cannot believe your luck.
The wait is almost unbearable, but soon, the day comes.
You make your way to the venue where Miku will be performing for all her adoring fans. You've never seen such a large crowd of people your entire life.
But soon, the music starts, and just like magic, Miku pops on stage performing all her greatest hits.
However, all too soon, the performance comes to an end. While you're a little saddened, you had a load of fun, and you can't help but smile.
But then, you see someone come up to you. It looks to be the concert attendant.
Excuse me, are you ~player~? Please follow me. Miku would like to see you.
Your eyes look at the lady in disbelief. Miku wanted to see me?! Did she really like me that much?
You don't question it any further. You follow the lady to Miku's dressing room.
Here we are. Just knock on the door. Now, I've got other things to attend to.
The lady walks away. Feeling a little nervous, you gently knock on the door.
"~player~, there you are! Please, come inside!"
You walk inside Miku's quarters. It has a warm, cozy feel to it. You sit down on a comfy chair in front of her.
~Player~, it's wonderful to see you again! How have you been?
You and Miku engage in a wonderful conversation, but soon, you subconciously notice the subject-matter begin to become a bit more... lewd.
~Player~, after playing strip poker with you, I wanted to try a new experience. In other words...
...would you like to fuck me?
Your face goes bright red at such a direct question. Without hesitation, you nod "Yes."
